data.title: Score Group streamlines its Asia Pacific operations
data.meta_description: Valve management services company Score Group has broadened its reach in the Asia Pacific region through the amalgamation of its Australian operations.
data.text:
(L-R) Matthew Kilgallon, Business Development Manager – Asia Pacific and Graeme Stephen, Business Unit Director – Asia Pacific outside the Score Australasia building in Perth, WA

Valve management services company Score Group has broadened its reach in the Asia Pacific region through the amalgamation of its Australian operations.

Now trading as Score Australasia Pty Ltd, the company’s facilities in Perth, Western Australia, are now the regional headquarters for its Asia Pacific businesses. The move strengthens and streamlines Score’s operations in Australia, which includes sites in Karratha, Gladstone and Chinchilla, with a new facility in Darwin soon to be opened. This will provide synergies for the local market, by combining Score’s expertise in engineering services, enabling an enhanced and more efficient approach to customer service. The merger will also help the business focus on developing new opportunities across the region and establishing closer working relationships with its customers and OEM partners.

Marking the company’s twenty-second year in Australia: Score Australasia offers full sales and technical customer support services across the country. The company’s complete product and service capabilities encompass valve supply; repair/overhaul; inspection and diagnostic services; extensive in-house valve/actuator stock; specialised testing services; warehouse and inventory management; onsite flange machining/management; component manufacture and coatings, including thermal spray. Matthew Kilgallon has been appointed business development manager for the company’s Asia Pacific interests and will lead on the company’s efforts to streamline the company’s capabilities, ensuring a collaborated approach to all services for its customers.

Graeme Stephen, Business Unit Director – Asia Pacific, commented:

“To better serve our customers, we have changed the way we operate. This is a very exciting development for Score Group’s operations across Asia Pacific, which have been in development for the last 12 months. I have already been encouraged by the positive feedback and support that our new company, Score Australasia, has received from all our customers and OEM partners. In 2021 and beyond, we look forward to supporting our existing customer base under this new cohesive approach to market and welcoming new customers, in this exciting time of change and expansion for our company.”

Matthew Kilgallon, Business Development Manager – Asia Pacific, continued:

“I’m delighted to be joining the team in Perth and supporting the development of our business across Asia Pacific. We recognise the need to invest in further support and development in this region and I look forward to building lasting relationships with existing and new customers.”

In support of business growth, Score Australasia and Score Asia currently have several exciting career opportunities available across the region, for more information please visit www.score-group.com/careers or email AsiaPacific@score-group.com

About Score Australasia Pty Ltd

Score Australasia, a Score Group company, is headquartered in Perth, Australia. The business provides valve supply, valve maintenance/servicing and gas turbine support to customers across the upstream oil and gas, downstream, chemical processing and mining industries across the Australasian region.

About Score Asia Sdn Bhd

Score Asia Sdn Bhd, a Score Group company, has operations in Kuala Lumpur and Terengganu. The business provides valve supply, valve maintenance/servicing and gas turbine support to customers across the upstream oil and gas, downstream, chemical processing and mining industries across Asia.

About Score Group Limited

Score Group is a specialist in precision manufacturing, valve supply, automation and management systems and provides complex engineering solutions to customers in multiple markets, including defence, nuclear, aerospace, utilities and energy.

The company was founded in 1982 by the late Charles Ritchie as an engineering services provider for valve management and industrial gas turbines. Today, Score Group is the global market leader in valve management and associated services for the upstream oil and gas industry. The company is now owned by private equity firm SCF Partners.
